data.title: Mid day snail craving
data.text: My wife and I stopped in at 1 pm and reviewed the menu. To my wife's disappointment they only serve escargot for dinner. She told them she was visiting and in the past they had it on the menu and Rachael our waitress, explained that it was a dinner option only but would plead our case with chef. 10 minutes  later we were enjoying the best escargot on the planet. Thanks Fish Tale for taking care of your customers.

data.title: Fabulous service and great food
data.text: Stopped in on the way to an appointment and had a wonderful meal with fabulous seafood and speedy service.  Food is always beautifully prepared and served (love the pistachio salmon).  As usual, wonderful  to  have Coral as our server as she consistently delivers personalized attention (she remembers her guests and their preferences) plus has a warm, friendly, and professional attitude.  Great food and great service make even a "quickie" meal relaxing and enjoyable.

data.title: Totally Amazing!
data.text: First off, we had the most fabulous waitress ever, Coral!  She was extremely customer service driven and very attentive to our needs.  I ordered the seafood chowder to start which was absolutely scrumptious.  My elderly mom chose not to order anything to start but Coral brought her a small sampling of the three different soups anyway which was so thoughtful.  This delighted my mom and warmed my heart.  My mom ordered the fried jumbo shrimp dinner which she said was fabulous.  I ordered the lunch trio special which consisted of lobster tail, skewered shrimp, and grouper bites along with tasty additional sides.  It was absolutely mouth watering delicious.  We were there on Sunday for lunch and the rest of the staff that day were exceptional as well.  I cannot wait to return to Fish Tale for another culinary delight.

data.title: Eating outside and watching the cars go by.
data.text: Eating outside, our waitress was always there asking if we need anything.  Their red wine was excellent!

data.title: Freshest seafood ever!
data.text: We have been going to Fish Tale Grill for a long time; we love the food, the atmosphere, and the staff, especially Coral whom we have known for years. I was, however, disappointed, when the menu was recently changed and quesadillas were removed from the menu; I loved the shrimp quesadillas, although I brought 1/2 of them home with me. Because I am not a big eater, I find the meals and the sandwiches are just too much food for me and they are a waste of money for me to order. My husband loves the blackened grouper sandwich and now there isn't much left for me to order except soup. Please bring back the quesadillas even as an appetizer.

data.title: Great local spot
data.text: Always great food! Chef specials each night. Inside and outside dining available. One of a kind spot.

data.title: Better than others
data.text:
Wife and I are new residents of Cape Coral after vacationing here for three years. We have tried many of the highly rated restaurants and for seafood ....This Is The Best.
Fresh seafood at its best and affordable. Great staff. good presentation and a great fish market on property. Don't miss this one.

data.title: Great after shopping apps
data.text: My fiance and I stopped here on our way back to the house after shopping all day.  We have bought seafood from merricks in the past and have eaten here in the past.  As always the staff was super friendly and helpful.  We ordered the oyster special which had tuna on top of raw oyster and then the tartar and escargot.  It was a perfect stop for fresh seafood and good cold drinks.  You should definitely stop here for dinner or drinks and apps

data.title: Still Good
data.text:
We came back after three years and enjoyed a good seafood dinner.
This time we started with a delicious  Lobster Bisque Soup and as the main course Cranberry Macadamia Sea Bass.
To this we had a bottle of Rodney Strong, Sonoma 2012.
We all enjoyed the food and will if possible be back again.

data.title: Great seafood and service
data.text: The food was delicious and affordable. The service was great. Coral, our server treated us like family.

data.title: Best food ever!
data.text: This restaurant is by far the best food we have eaten in the Cape Coral, Fort Myers area. Presentation was fabulous. Our waitress Coral was really great. This is our first visit and we will return again soon. A great surprise is the seafood market which has great selections for take home cooking.

data.title: Great Seafood!
data.text: Have been here many times and always have had great seafood. I love their lunches especially the salads. They always have a nice selection of fresh seafood. You can sit inside or out on the patio.

data.title: Excellent fresh seafood
data.text: My wife and I have dined here on multiple occasions both in the dining room and on the deck. Food and service is always on point. The menu is diverse emphasis on seafood. We have never had a selection that was less than delicious. Always at the top of the short list when we are deciding where to go.

data.title: Another delic dinner!
data.text:
2nd time visit, and certainly will be a top pick for years to come! 

Colleen was amazing, our waitress was by far the best at what she does.  

We tried the spicy lobster spring roll app, which was so full of flavor, and the lobster bisque was insanely yummy!  Bread was perfectly warm with their special tomato roasted butter!  

We were so full, never made it into their seafood market... next time!

data.title: Have been there three times and never disappointed.
data.text: The early bird specials are a great value. The service has always been spot on, not to hurried and just the right amount of wait between courses. The menu is diverse, seafood always  a good choice and never run of the mill. Would recommend for special occasion or just want to have a night without the cooking. Will go again, soon.

data.title: What are we missing at Fish Tale?
data.text: We spend at least 4 weeks a year in Cape Coral, but we inevitably head for ft myers, if not Naples for a quality restaurant experience. Today we noticed the many positive reviews for this nr 1 trip advisor rated restaurant in Cape Coral, and decided to stay closer to home. Unfortunately, we were not as impressed as many have been. We had a nice table on the outside deck, but to start with, the menu itself was decorated diner-like with caked food, not a great first impression. We both ordered grouper, served with mixed vegetables and mashed potatoes. The presentation was nice, the fish was fresh and tasty, but the vegetables less so (we also ordered sides of asparagus). The entre came with a salad, which looked limp and tired... in my estimation likely prepared hours in advance, with a few sad looking bits of ground carrot on top. My wife - a great salad lover - left most of hers. The wine list is very limited, but a new zealand sauvignon blanc fit in well at a reasonable price. Overall we were left wondering if we perhaps hit an off night, or simply arrived with expectations too high.

data.title: A Tasty Find
data.text: Fish Tale Grill is a yummy place to enjoy fresh seafood.  It's in the same building as Merrick Seafood, and the fish is excellent.  I enjoyed both the grouper fish tacos and seafood chowder.  Our waitress, Coral, was friendly, attentive and helpful. I can't wait to go back for another meal.

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text:
I have been to Fish Tale several times over the past 3 years and always found the food to be very high quality and the service excellent.  

This week and last I had lunch there and Coral was my waitperson.  She remembered me and, without my asking, seated me in the table I like.  That is a touch I appreciate.

I seem to be stuck on the pistachio encrusted salmon with rice and asparagus.  This is an excellent bargain for $14.  The salmon is a large, beautifully prepared piece and the rice and asparagus are savory from the sweet pistachio crust on the salmon.  Yummy and I eat every bite.

The key lime pie is sweet and tart and is an authentic version of this Florida classic.  My only quibble is that they do not use real whipped cream, which is a must with such good pie.

They have a nice selection of wines by the glass as well.

All in all, a most pleasant way to spend some time for lunch.  I know this place gets mobbed for dinner, especially during season.  So go for lunch, skip the crowds and enjoy some delicious seafood.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great dinner and service. Try the oysters and tuna appetizer. It was amazing. Wife had sea bass and i had seafood pasta and both were out of this world

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Three of us went to celebrate a friend's birthday. It was a new place for two of us and the third had been there a couple years ago. Since service in a restaurant is very important I'll start with that - it was excellent. Our waitress was was very personable and attentive. We each ordered a different dish - one had the seafood platter, another had the bourbon salmon and I had the grouper picatta. Since we first 'eat with our eyes' I must say the presentation of each dish was beautiful. After taking one taste we forgot the presentation and just enjoyed the wonderful flavors. The person who'd been there before was very impressed and said the food was better than she'd had a couple years ago so they must have a new cheff. It's a definite do-again for all of us.
